aim4.voronoi

Class PQ

  • java.lang.Object
    • aim4.voronoi.PQ

  • public class PQ
extends java.lang.Object
    A hash table to store half-edges.
    Author:
    Steven Benoit

      Constructs a new PQ.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PQ

        public PQ(int sqrtNsites,
          double minSiteY,
          double siteYspan)
        Constructs a new PQ.
        Parameters:
        sqrtNsites - the square root of (the number of sites + 4)
        minSiteY - the minimum Y value of any site
        siteYspan - the total Y height spanned by all sites

    • Method Detail

      • bucket

        public int bucket(Halfedge he)
        Determines the bucket where a half-edge should be stored. The bucket is based on the y* value, and runs from 0 (y* is at the minimum y) to the hash-size (y* is at the maximum y).

        The minimum hash bucket is updated if the result is smaller than the current minimum.

        Parameters:
        he - the half-edge
        Returns:
        the bucket

      • insert

        public void insert(Halfedge he,
                   Site v,
                   double offset)
        Adds the HalfEdge to the ordered linked list of vertices in its appropriate bucket.
        Parameters:
        he - the half edge to add
        v - the vertex the half edge is associated with
        offset - the offset from y to y* (distance to nearest site)

      • delete

        public void delete(Halfedge he)
        Removes the HalfEdge from the list of vertices.
        Parameters:
        he - the half edge to remove

      • empty

        public boolean empty()
        Tests whether the hashtable is empty.
        Returns:
        true if the hash table is empty

      • min

        public Vertex min()
        Gets the vertex in the hashtable with the minimum y-star value.
        Returns:
        the vertex

      • extractMin

        public Halfedge extractMin()
        Gets the half edge with the minimum y-star value and deletes that half edge from the hashtable.
        Returns:
        the half-edge
